posts.body:
>>2b31b1bd-f8f6-419c-a018-22ba753fda71
I'm pretty sure this decentralised network is anti-DDoS as well. The more traffic these sites receive, the more peers you have to seed from. It's literally impenetrable. So we've gone from a flimsy potato server to a "server" made up of the sum of its users.
Reminds me of the dark web in Almost Human

>>00b50ac6-30a9-40e2-bf4d-d6d79ee1ce92
>>070284fc-c04f-4c0b-b2e1-1c87952da569
>>2021ff69-ab4f-46f2-8689-59f1a2e6cbec
Deleting users.json does remove ~~your mute list and~~ any customisation on the homepage. However, I'm sure there is a logical solution. I'm currently going to test editing the users.json file and manually scrubbing the certificate for your identity out. I'll come back and tell you what I find.

''UPDATE:'' As >>70e85258-a2bd-48ab-96c7-f53c9293761c pointed out, you don't delete your filters if you delete the users.json file. However, if you own a board, you'll lose your ownership privileges.

>>70e85258-a2bd-48ab-96c7-f53c9293761c
You're right. I must've made a mistake there. It only applies to your personal settings, not your filter. I'll edit the original post to reflect that.

>>00b50ac6-30a9-40e2-bf4d-d6d79ee1ce92
>>070284fc-c04f-4c0b-b2e1-1c87952da569
>>2021ff69-ab4f-46f2-8689-59f1a2e6cbec
>>f091c18a-f414-41f1-a000-dff21bd33ca0
>>70e85258-a2bd-48ab-96c7-f53c9293761c
So I worked out that you can manually scrub out your identity from the users.json file ~~like in pic related~~. I'm now testing if you can manually add certificates yourself to the file.

Testing to see if I can post this with no image...
Edit: For some reason, it won't let me upload the image, but w/e

>>c2e5fe73-3f4d-48a0-93e9-5fba384c4407
So everyone automatically has a tripcode in this system by default, instead of generic "anonymity"? Interesting change. Just means that newfags will struggle to fit in and glows can be spotted faster and muted out of existence.

>>061ebe6c-d47e-40fc-b150-e6cdae714f87
>deletes mutes
It doesn't, it just resets user settings and ID, including things like BO credentials.

>>8656fb48-5053-46f5-a694-c402081adffd
So crisis averted? Just means that making backups is more important than ever.

>>3d20f025-6aaa-4afa-9713-86b90adba487
>enable the multiuser plugin to do that
How?

>>953e4ff6-91c8-4d8e-8da9-4708a7237482
>no archive
Just because we're in the bunker, doesn't mean rules no longer apply.
The CP on 8chan was COINTELPRO, not organic users

>Implying
What's wrong with the internet no longer existing as you know it?

>>7e5146b4-d2c7-4e67-89af-95a866c9d1b4
>There is no escape from Big Brother
Imagine wanting to escape instead of tackle the issue head on. ''You can run but you can't hide''.

>>30b70d75-6bba-4b36-9994-da1991a27231
I just looked for my old blacklist.json. It seems it gets wiped automatically when you relaunch ZeroNet after deleting users.json
